publisher.publisher-name: Dalarna University Centre for Irish Studies (DUCIS), Nordic Irish Studies Network (NISN)

title-group.article-title: Introduction. Discourses of Inclusion and Exclusion: Artistic Renderings of Marginal Identities in Ireland

ref.mixed-citation: Bery Ashok and Patricia Murray, eds. 'Introduction', Comparing Postcolonial Literatures: Dislocations (London: Macmillan Press, 2000) 1-17;
Catherine L. Innés, 'Postcolonial Studies in Ireland', Comparing Postcolonial Literatures: Dislocations , eds. Ashok Bery and Patricia Murray (London: Macmillan Press, 2000) 21-30.
Declan Kiberd, Inventing Ireland: The Literature of the Modern Nation (London: Vintage, 1995).
David Lloyd, Anomalous States: Irish Writing and the Post-colonial Moment (Dublin: Lilliput, 1993);
Edna Longley, The Living Stream: Literature and Revisionism in Ireland (Newcastle: Bloodaxe, 1994),
Clare Carroll and Patricia King, eds. Ireland and Postcolonial Theory (Cork: Cork University Press, 2003),
Bryan Fanning, Immigration and Social Change in the Republic of Ireland (Manchester: Manchester University Press, 2007);
Borbála Faragó and Moynagh Sullivan, eds. Facing the Other: Interdisciplinary Studies on Race, Gender, and Social Justice in Ireland (Newcastle: Cambridge Scholars, 2008);
Pilar Villar-Argáiz and Jason King, eds. 'Integration, Migration and Recession in Post-Celtic Tiger Ireland', special issue, Irish Studies Review (2016).
John Hills, Julian le Grand and David Piachaud, eds. Understanding Social Exclusion (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002).
